mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, H. T. Harrison to John Augustine Washington III, 1845 December 29
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Harrison, Henry Tazewell, 1796-1881
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Harrison writes from Leesburg to Augustine about Julia, an enslaved woman, who has taken "French leave" after Harrison struck her half a dozen times with his horse whip for disobedience. Harrison thinks Julia may have gone to Mount Vernon and asks Augustine to write if he has seen her. Autograph letter signed, 1 page.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Slaves
